body.p: Lumipulse G Total Tau is an assay system, including a set of immunoassay reagents, for the quantitative measurement of total Tau in specimens based on CLEIA technology8) by a specific two-step immunoassay method on the LUMIPULSE G System.

strow.stentry: Total Tau Calibrator or specimen and biotinylated antibody solution are both added to particle solution.

Total Tau in specimens or calibrators specifically binds to anti-total Tau monoclonal antibody (mouse) on the particles, and biotinylated antibody (mouse). Biotinylated antibody-antigen immuno-complexes are formed.
The particles are washed and rinsed to remove unbound materials.
Alkaline phosphatase (ALP)-labeled streptavidin specifically binds to biotinylated immuno-complexes on the particles.

stentry.p: The particles are washed and rinsed to remove unbound materials.

strow.stentry: Substrate Solution is added and mixed with the particles. AMPPD* contained in the Substrate Solution is dephosphorylated by the catalysis of ALP indirectly conjugated to particles.
Luminescence (at a maximum wavelength of 477 nm) is generated by the cleavage reaction of dephosphorylated AMPPD. The luminescent signal reflects the amount of total Tau present in the sample.
